page.title: 02Education. Primary School.
page.content: Downton Primary School is a Victorian building, built in 1895. There are 7 classrooms.In the playground are 3 mobiles,2 are used for classrooms and one is an artroom.Our classroom is class 7.It is at the far end of the main building.It has a high ceiling and windows.There are 36 pupils in the class.Each has a wooden desk.We write in exercise books, in ink. The lessons we have are:English,Primary and Topic Maths,Topic Work,Creative Writing, Individual Topic, Science, Music, P.E. and Games. We use the Scottish Primary Mathematics Group scheme of work. We use one of the school computers on Monday, Wednesday and Friday. We have display boards for our work and can use the Junior practical area for extra space. On Friday mornings we go swimming in Salisbury.
